Description: Fragment of a terracotta figure herm, broken at neck. Long hair at back, detail indicated by slight incisions. Mould-made. Mould join retouched, hair detailed with a modelling-tool. Traces of white coating, blue and pink paint. Solid red-brown Nile silt with abundant mica.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Good parallel from a Ptolemaic context from Athribis (Tell Atrib) (Szmańska 2005, no.207). Parallels from Egypt are generally dated Ptolemaic or late Ptolemaic (Fjeldhagen 1995, no.90; Millers 1991, 54, cat. 25, fig.30; Dunand 1990, no. 325). Three Ptolemaic herm figures are known from Naukratis, all from different mould series (Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.400; Amsterdam, Allard Pierson Museum 7479; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.488). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Fjeldhagen, M. 1995, Catalogue Graeco-Roman Terracottas from Egypt, Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek, Copenhagen. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.241) (Phase 3)
